question.content:
**Is $x$ greater than, less than, or equal to $139^\circ$?**

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A slant line intersects a horizontal line, forming four angles. The top-left and bottom-right angles are X and 139 degrees, respectively.

choices.clue: The labeled angles are vertical angles because they are opposite each other at the intersection of two lines. Vertical angles are always equivalent.
The labeled angles are vertical angles because they are opposite each other at the intersection of two lines. Vertical angles are always equivalent.

hints.content:
The two angles are opposite each other where two lines cross.

This means the angles are vertical angles.

options.explanation:
The upper right and lower right angles add up to $180^\circ$ because they are adjacent and form a straight line.

 $ \pink{\text{upper right angle}} = 180^{\circ} - \blue{139^{\circ}} = \pink{41^{\circ}} $

[[☃ image 1]]

The upper right and upper left angles also add up to $180^\circ$ because they are adjacent and form a straight line too.

 $ \green{\text{upper left angle}}= 180^{\circ} - \pink{41^{\circ}} = \green{139^{\circ}}$

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A slant line intersects a horizontal line, forming four angles. The top-left, top-right, and bottom-right angles are X, 41, and 139 degrees, respectively.
A slant line intersects a horizontal line, forming four angles. The top-left, top-right, and bottom-right angles are 139, 41, and 139 degrees, respectively.
